page.title: 03DUNHAM MASSEY PARK.
page.content: Dunham Park expands over 250 acres.There are many sights in the park,including the hall,2000 trees have been planted.The dead ones have been cut up to use as a protective fence around the new saplings.Some of the elm trees had to be cut down,because they had been attacked by 'Dutch Elm Disease'.Amongst variety of trees are the Alder,Elm,Oak and Birch.About 200 deer roam freely,and at night they shelter in the deer barn.A small area of the park is fenced over.This is called the deer sanctuary.It is a place where no member of the public may enter.This is where the deer can have some rest.There are now 200 deer.There is a slaughter house where the deer are shot when they are too old or when they become savage.
